intro: Chassalia hallii, commonly known as the Hall's chassalia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Chassalia hallii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
